contentrichtext.text: {{Advert|date=January 2010}} {{Coord|53|35|28|N|113|29|15|W|type:landmark|display=title}} {{Infobox Education in Canada |name= Queen Elizabeth High School |image= |imagesize= |streetaddress= 9425 132 Ave |city= [[Edmonton]] |province= [[Alberta]] |postalcode= |areacode= 780 |phone= |fax= |email= |url= [http://queene.epsb.net/ Queen Elizabeth High School] |schoolnumber= |schoolboard= [[Edmonton Public Schools]] |superintendent= |trustee= |affiliation= |principal= Don Blackwell |assistant principal= Brenda Scaddan |Social Department Head= Brenda Scaddan |Science Department Head= Tanya Buhlmann |viceprincipal= |administrator= |resourceofficer= Darrell Kushniruk |schooltype= [[State school|Public]] [[secondary school]] |grades= 10–12 |mascot= The Knight |motto = Virili Parte |motto_translation = To the Utmost of Our Ability |teamname= Knights |colours= [[Purple]] {{color box|purple}} and [[Gold (color)|gold]] {{color box|gold}} (Blue/Gold for some male sports) |founded= 1960 |enrollment= 1,335 (2011) }} '''Queen Elizabeth Composite High School''', located in north [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]], [[Canada]], is a senior high school in the [[Edmonton Public School Board|Edmonton Public School System]]. ==History== The Queen Elizabeth High School is named after [[Queen Elizabeth II]], elder daughter of [[King George VI]] and [[Queen Elizabeth, The Queen Mother]] of the United Kingdom. ==Academic programs== The school has advanced placement classes. These classes are extremely difficult, but there are many people who actually make it into these classes and obtained high marks.<ref name="slcata"/> The school has an aviation program instructing students interested in getting a private pilot license, taught by teacher/flight instructor Alan Newsome. The program covers a curriculum provided by Transport. Canada.<ref>[http://www.canadianflightinstitute.com/groundschool/course/category.php?id=3] Web page titled "Queen Elizabeth Private Pilot Groundschool" at the Canadian Flight Institute Web site, accessed October 29, 2007</ref> ==Athletics== The school athletic teams are called the 'Queen Elizabeth Knights', and the school colours are purple and gold. Athletic programs at the school include: Badminton, Ball Hockey, Basketball,Cross-Country, Football, Rugby, Soccer, Team Handball, Volleyball, Weight Training, and Wrestling and curling. ==Individual Support Program== The Individual Support Program, for students with severe to profound developmental delays, occupies a classroom and a small, enclosed courtyard which features a rock waterfall, wooden bridge, limestone pathway, and shrubbery, along with a pagoda with spruce log seats and teaching stone. The courtyard, created in 2005, is used as a "Living Classroom" as well as for high school activities and community events. About 20 students are in the program, ranging in age from 14 to 20.<ref name=slcata>[http://www.teachers.ab.ca/Quick+Links/Publications/ATA+News/Volume+41/Number+6/In+the+News/School%E2%80%99s+living+classroom+is+a+treasure.htm] Web page titled "School’s living classroom is a treasure" at the Alberta Teachers' Association Web site, accessed October 29, 2007</ref> Judges for the 2006/07 School–Community Public Relations Awards selected "The Living Classroom," for the School Award of Excellence.<ref>[http://www.teachers.ab.ca/Quick+Links/Publications/ATA+News/Volume+41/Number+14/In+the+News/Living+Classroom+receives+School+Community+award.htm] Macdonald, Koni, ""Living Classroom" receives ATA’s School–Community award", article at the Alberta Teachers' Association Web site, accessed October 29, 2007</ref> ==English as Second Language== English as Second Language (known as ESL) is program for newcomers from many different countries to learn English. Many students who successfully finished ESL courses will enroll to regular dash two classes. ==Notable alumni== *[[Darryl Boessenkool]], [[Edmonton Oilers]]' Vice-President of Finance & CFO ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://queene.epsb.net/ Queen Elizabeth High School Web Page] {{High Schools in Edmonton}} [[Category:High schools in Edmonton]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1960]]
